tech_news.title: Anker’s display-equipped Nano Charger is on sale following its CES debut - The Verge
tech_news.description: Anker’s new 45W Nano Charger is on sale for $10 off ahead of its launch on January 20th. The Nothing Ear Open and Breville’s Barista Express are also on sale.

tech_news.title: I tested Apple’s hands-free Home Key — and it’s a big upgrade - The Verge
tech_news.description: Aqara’s new U400 smart lock is the first to use Apple’s UWB-based hands-free unlocking, and it works every time, even with full hands.

tech_news.title: Amazon’s Ring doorbells get fire alerts, an app store and new sensors - TechCrunch
tech_news.description: The new Ring Sensors can detect motion, openings, glass breakage, and smoke, and can also monitor carbon monoxide levels, leaks, temperature changes, and air quality.

tech_news.title: Dell’s new 4K QD-OLED monitor offers true 10-bit color - The Verge
tech_news.description: The UltraSharp 32 4K QD-OLED is launching February 24th for $2,599.99 and boasts incredible color accuracy.

tech_news.title: Romeo Is a Dead Man shatters space-time and expectations - Polygon
tech_news.description: Romeo Is a Dead Man is a wild third-person action game with a chaotic storyline, unique visuals, and blood-tingling combat.

tech_news.title: 500 Worlds: Titus – C’tan shards and Destroyers flood the field with new Necrons Detachments - Warhammer Community
tech_news.description: Want to use all the C’tan shards at once? Of course you do!

tech_news.title: Imagine Paying $200 for a Security Camera When Your Old Phone Does the Same Thing for Free - CNET
tech_news.description: If you have an unused phone in a drawer, learn how to use it for home surveillance.

tech_news.title: No, Microsoft didn’t rebrand Office to Microsoft 365 Copilot - The Verge
tech_news.description: Microsoft’s Office website is confusing the internet. Despite lots of posts, Microsoft hasn’t rebranded Office to Microsoft 365 Copilot.

tech_news.title: ‘Autofocus’ glasses can change their lenses in real time - CNN
tech_news.description: Finnish eyewear company IXI is gearing up to launch smart glasses that look just like ordinary spectacles, but are able to “autofocus” based on the perceived needs of the wearer.
